text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Carinthia | native_name = Kärnten | native_name_lang = de | settlement_type = State of Austria | image_flag = Flag of Kärnten.svg | flag_size = 120px | image_shield = Kaernten CoA.svg | shield_size = 75px | image_map = Kärnten in Austria.svg | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Austria | seat_type = Capital | seat = Klagenfurt | leader_party = SPÖ | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = Peter Kaiser | area_total_km2 = 9538.01 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 560300 | population_as_of = 1 January 2016 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +1 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +2 | blank_name_sec1 = | blank_info_sec1 = | blank1_name_sec1 = | blank1_info_sec1 = | blank1_name_sec2 = Votes in Bundesrat | blank1_info_sec2 = 4 (of 62) | blank_name_sec2 = NUTS Region | blank_info_sec2 = AT2 | iso_code = AT-2 |coordinates= | website = www.ktn.gv.at | footnotes = }} Carinthia ( ; ; ; ) is the southernmost state of Austria. It is in the Eastern Alps. The main language is German. Carinthia's main industries are tourism, electronics, engineering, forestry and agriculture. The companies Philips and Siemens have large operations there. == Districts == The state is divided into eight rural and two urban districts. There are 132 towns. === Statutory cities === * Klagenfurt * Villach === Rural districts === * Spittal an der Drau * Hermagor * Villach-Land * Feldkirchen * St. Veit an der Glan * Klagenfurt-Land * Völkermarkt * Wolfsberg ==References==
title: Carinthia
